Key Match Events: Luis Gil pitched six sharp innings in his return from a back injury, allowing only one hit and striking out seven.
Aaron Judge hit an RBI double and scored on Austin Wells' two-run single.
Luke Weaver handled the ninth inning for his first career save in 199 major league appearances.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone commented, 'It was a good day.'
Craig Counsell reflected, 'I thought Gil threw the ball well, but we got to do a better job.'
Anthony Rizzo expressed, 'It was just cool to be here. A lot of smiles.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had an attendance of 40,101.
It was New York's first shutout since Aug. 23 against Colorado and No. 12 on the season overall.
Anthony Rizzo received multiple standing ovations from the crowd at Wrigley Field.
